profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-09-02T13:53-0400

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes a copy of "Political Affairs" with Levenson article "US Communists in Spain;" seven photos including a group shot of New York University volunteers in Spain (copy print), a 1986 GDR commemorative event at Thaelmann Park in Berlin, and a group shot with Levenson of the FBI Players receiving an award from J. Edgar Hoover; and a cap worn by Levenson in Spain. On September 1, 2005, Levenson donated of several boxes of books and a three drawer file cabinet. The contents of the file cabinet fill four boxes and include artifacts, a few audio tapes, clippings and many files. The files include correspondence, some dating from the Spanish Civil War; VALB files; essays and reviews by Levenson and others; individual files on several American veterans of the Spanish Civil War; and subject files. The collection also includes research materials and drafts for an article "U.S. Communists in Spain: A Profile," which was published in Political Affairs in 1986.
